inclusion.criterion: Clinical diagnosis of type 1 diabetes and using daily insulin therapy for at least one year and an insulin infusion pump for at least 6 months.
inclusion.label: unknown

inclusion.criterion: Uninterrupted internet access while study system is being used overnight and for upload of study data in the morning
inclusion.label: unknown

inclusion.criterion: Living with a family member/guardian ("companion") committed to participating in all study activities, and being present and available to provide assistance when the system is being used at night
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: An understanding of and willingness to follow the protocol and sign the informed consent
inclusion.label: unknown

exclusion.criterion: Diabetic ketoacidosis in the past 6 months
exclusion.label: not_met

exclusion.criterion: Hypoglycemic seizure or loss of consciousness in the past 6 months
exclusion.label: not_met

exclusion.criterion: History of seizure disorder (except for hypoglycemic seizure)
exclusion.label: unknown

exclusion.criterion: History of any heart disease including coronary artery disease, heart failure, or arrhythmias
exclusion.label: not_met

exclusion.criterion: Current use of oral/inhaled glucocorticoids, beta-blockers or other medications, which in the judgment of the investigator would be a contraindication to participation in the study.
exclusion.label: unknown

exclusion.criterion: History of ongoing renal disease (other than microalbuminuria). Creatinine level must have been obtained within the last year if subject has diabetes of >10 years duration.
exclusion.label: not_met

notes: Patient A is a 30-year-old male with TB. He has not had diabetic ketoacidosis or hypoglycemic seizure in the past 6 months, and does not have heart disease or cystic fibrosis.
